title: Keith Gumbs
text:
Keith "Kayamba" Gumbs (born 11 September 1972 in <a href="Saint%20Kitts">St. Kitts</a>, <a href="Saint%20Kitts%20and%20Nevis">Saint Kitts and Nevis</a>) is a retired <a href="Saint%20Kitts%20and%20Nevis%20national%20football%20team">St. Kitts and Nevis international</a> <a href="Football%20%28soccer%29">football</a> player.
Playing career.
Gumbs' began playing football, while he was attending the Newtown Primary School (now the Tucker/Clarke Primary School), continued at Basseterre Junior High (now the Washington Archilbald High School) and then Basseterre Senior High where he finished his schooling. Gumbs played other different sports, including <a href="cricket">cricket</a> and <a href="basketball">basketball</a>.
In his debut first division season in 1989, he helped <a href="Newtown%20United%20FC">Newtown</a> to win the double (league and cup) earning him a called up to the National Senior team by the then head coach Alphonso Bridgewater.
Gumbs now plays amateur football in Australia, where he now lives.
Coaching career.
Gumbs began his coaching career as a Physical Coach on <a href="Sriwijaya%20F.C.">Sriwijaya F.C.</a> in 2011-2012 Season as a player and Physical Coach. In <a href="2016%20Indonesia%20Soccer%20Championship%20A">2016 Indonesia Soccer Championship A</a> he was appointed again to be Assistant coach of <a href="Sriwijaya%20F.C.">Sriwijaya F.C.</a>
International goals.
"Saint Kitts and Nevis' score is listed first."
